moves.1. e4 c5: All right, here we have the sicilian defence.The next move does not comply with any variations of the sicilian.
moves.2. Bc4: White sets himself up for the scholar's mate. How many times do we have to go through this?
moves.2... Nc6 3. Bxf7+: If only I played either 2...e3 or 2...Nh6. Now, it's a forced take.
moves.3... Kxf7 4. Qh5+ g6: It was this or 3...Ke6?!. Definitely do not play 3...Kf6?? 4.Qf5# in this situation.
moves.6. Ne2 Ke8: I know I cannot castle any more, but I could probably try placing the King back to it's spot.
moves.7. Qc3: White's Queen recked havoc on my King and now it's after my Rook!?
moves.7... Nf6 8. d3: White's on fire, so I decide that the best I can do, is to prepare for his attacks.
moves.8... Bg7 9. O-O Ng4: This unworthy move costs me my entire King-side. Better was 9...Ng5.
moves.10. Bf4 d6: I have to admit, I would have a very slim advantage after 10...Bc3. If White responds with 11.Bxc7, then 11...Bxb2 earns me a free Rook.
moves.11. Qxg7 Rf8 12. Qxh7 Nce5 13. d4: I can possibly take the risk with 13...Qxc2!?.
moves.13... Rf7 14. Qh8+ Rf8 15. Qh4 Nf6: I'm not sure why I did this move.
moves.18. Ng3 Bf5: Being down on material does not mean this is a logical move.
moves.19. exf5 gxf5 20. Bxf6: Black is lost, regardless of what he does.
moves.26. Nc7: This game is thrown out of the window. The Rooks can be saved in a couple of ways.
moves.26... Rc6 27. Qh4 Rxc7 28. Qh7+: The c7 Rook drowned in hot soup with this astounding Queen check.
moves.28... Kf8 29. Qxc7 Re7: This move makes matters worse by making White's Queen check me and wriggle my King away from safety.
moves.30. Qd8+: White has no other help yet and should have delayed this move.
moves.30... Re8 31. Qa5 Qd4 32. Rfd1 b6: 32...Re7 is a way better move than this.
moves.33. Qxa7 Qc5 34. Nh5 Re7 35. Qb8+: White should have been careful about this move and played 35.Rb8+
moves.35... Re8 36. Qb7 Re7: I should have been more careful about my Rook. Better was the risky 36.Qe7!?.
moves.39... Qe8 40. Qa6 Qc6 41. Qd3 Qe8 42. Qg: Absolutely no guardian for the knight spells trouble, for the 3-move Queen war ends here. However, I did not think that White had another possible advantage.
moves.42... Qxh5 43. Rc1 Qf7 44. Qxe5: I lose, reguardless of how impressive my other moves are. I decided to play it through, though.
No possible way out of mate.
moves.51. Rg7+ Kh6 52. Qh8#: I learned from this loss. Motto: When taking pieces and blocking checks, check for holes in your position.
